intro: Asyneuma linifolium subsp. glabrum, commonly known as the smoothleaf asyneuma, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its linear, glabrous leaves that are often arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense, terminal clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland or rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within the Asteraceae family.
